Primary Offense: drug or medical equipment safety violation
Description: GNC Holdings Inc. entered into a wide-ranging agreement with the Department of Justice to reform its practices related to potentially unlawful dietary ingredients and dietary supplements, and has further promised to embark on a series of voluntary initiatives designed to improve the quality and purity of dietary supplements. As part of the agreement, GNC agreed to pay $2.25 million to the U.S. government and cooperate in dietary supplement investigations conducted by the government.
Agency: Food and Drug Administration referral to the Justice Department

Private Litigation Case Title: VARGAS et al v. GENERAL NUTRITION CENTERS, INC. et al
Most et al v. General Nutrition Centers, Inc et al
Shockley et al v. General Nutrition Corporation

Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of Orange

Description: General Nutrition Corp. agreed to pay refunds and $1 million for costs in settlement of allegations it deceived consumers into buying out-of-date products.

Agency: New York City Commission on Human Rights
